Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Bob Kaplan, Director, Cause-NY, a division of the Jewish Community Relations Council of New York, 70 W. 36th Street, New York, NY 10018.	

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Nelson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Bob Kaplan, Director, Cause-NY, a division of the Jewish Community Relations Council of New York, 70 West 36th Street, New York, N.Y. 10018.    

Council Member Nelson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of June 10, June 15 and June 19, 2009 be adopted as printed by Council Member Lappin.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Lappin moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 10, 2009 and Recessed Meetings of June 15 and 19, 2009 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Arva R. Rice, candidate for appointment by the Council to the New York City Equal Employment Practices Commission pursuant to § 830 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Arva R. Rice, Equal Employment Practices Commission

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 090431 ZSM and C090432 ZSM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure (C090431ZSM and C090432ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Koppell:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 3535 Riverdale Avenue, Borough, CB 8, Application no. 20095528 TCX shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, Jasper’s Pizza & More, LLC d/b/a Jasper’s Italian Cuisine, Bronx (20095528TCX)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 090443 ZSK , and shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to  Uniform Land Use Procedure Application  nos. C 090441 ZMK, N 090442.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Atara Vanderbilt, LLC, Brooklyn (C090443ZSK)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 090445 ZSK, and shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to Uniform Land Use Procedure Application nos. C 090444 ZMK, C 090446 HAK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Navy Green, Brooklyn

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Environmental Protection
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to retrofitting of and age limitations on diesel fuel-powered school buses.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring retrofitting and the use of ultra-low sulfur diesel fuel for school buses that transport fewer than 10 students at one time.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing a biotechnology credit against the general corporation tax, and the unincorporated business tax.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Providing a biotechnology credit against the general corporation tax, and the unincorporated business tax.

Items.Title: General Order Calendar
Commissioner of Deeds
Items.MatterName: Commissioner of Deeds

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to commercial recycling.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Commercial recycling.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the installation of cigarette waste receptacles outside of all city-owned buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Installation of cigarette waste receptacles outside of all city-owned buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass H.R. 2695, an act that would allow merchants to collectively negotiate with credit card providers over interchange fees.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass H.R. 2695, an act that would allow merchants to collectively negotiate with credit card providers over interchange fees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Mayor of the City of New York to examine how the City’s economic policies can be strengthened to address the disparate unemployment rate and joblessness of black New Yorkers which have increased due to the current recession.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Examine how the City’s economic policies can be strengthened to address the disparate unemployment rate and joblessness of black New Yorkers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring retail stores to have lights off when closed.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring retail stores to have lights off when closed.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.1255/S.1735, which authorizes homeowners and not-for-profit agencies in New York City to receive an abatement of real property taxes up to two thousand dollars for the cost of installing sewer improvement check valve devices on certain dwellings.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Authorizes homeowners and not-for-profit agencies in NYC to receive an abatement of real property taxes up to $2000 for the cost of installing sewer improvement check valve devices on certain dwellings. (A.1255/S.1735)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notification of certain changes involving parking meters.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Notification of changes in parking meter regulations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to community board review of transportation pilot projects.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Community board review of transportation pilot projects.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring exterior lighting to contain fully shielded fixtures.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring exterior lighting to contain fully shielded fixtures.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to licensing newsstands.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Licensing newsstands.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a temporary task force to review outsourcing by City agencies.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Establishing a temporary task force to review outsourcing by City agencies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the commissioner of the department of correction to report on race and ethnicity, zip code of residence, precinct of arrest and charged offense of adolescents admitted to city jails.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of the dept of correction to report on race and ethnicity, zip code of residence, precinct of arrest and charged offense of adolescents admitted to city jails.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring  containers for foods packaged on premises to be made of recyclable material.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring containers for foods packaged on premises to be made of recyclable material.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to ensure the strict enforcement of all current laws and regulations regarding the sale of foods and beverages which are not part of the school nutrition program, follow all recommendations contained in the State Comptroller’s report on New York City Department of Education School Nutrition, and monitor carefully the content and accessibility of school vending machines.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Regarding the sale of foods and beverages which are not part of the school nutrition program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring local representation on park conservancies.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Local representation on park conservancies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the location of concessions within a park.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Location of concessions within a park.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the federal government to pass H.R. 658, which would help to increase community input as the United States Postal Service reorganizes branches throughout the city of New York and the country, and also calling upon the Postal Service to use a significant portion of the $3.5 billion increase in its operating budget, received when President Obama signed into law Public Law 111-68, to prevent the closing of as many postal locations as possible throughout the City and the nation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: United States Postal Service Financial Relief Act (H.R.22 / H.R. 658)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to permissible parking of vehicles when alternate side of the street rules are in effect for purposes of street cleaning.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Permissible parking of vehicles when alternate side of the street rules are in effect for purposes of street cleaning.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to amend the New York State Labor Law in relation to apprenticeship training programs, to enable the City of New York to reverse chronic long term unemployment in certain neighborhoods.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Apprenticeship training programs, to enable the City of New York to reverse chronic long term unemployment in certain neighborhoods.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass the Uniting American Families Act of 2009 (H.R.1024/S. 424) or other legislation which would provide a mechanism under the Immigration and Nationality Act to allow United States citizens and legal permanent residents in binational same-sex relationships to sponsor their foreign-born partners for lawful permanent resident status in a manner consistent with the legal requirements and rights currently enjoyed by opposite-sex couples.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Uniting American Families Act of 2009 (H.R.1024 / S. 424)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale or installation of a motorcycle exhaust device without federal EPA required labeling.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale or installation of a motorcycle exhaust device without federal EPA required labeling.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R.1549/S.619, the Preservation of Antibiotics for Medical Treatment Act of 2009, legislation that would prohibit the routine use of certain types of antibiotics in farm animals in an effort to reduce the spread of dangerous bacteria in humans.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Preservation of Antibiotics for Medical Treatment Act of 2009 (H.R.1549/S.619)

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the extension of the Times Square Business Improvement District in the Borough of Manhattan and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the extension of such district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Times Square Business Improvement District

Items.Title: Resolution concerning an amendment to the District Plan of the Times Square Business Improvement District that provides for a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing of the local law authorizing a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge in the Times Square Business Improvement District is based.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Times Square Business Improvement District

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 090379 HAK, an Urban Development Action Area Designation and Project, located at 640 Broadway and the disposition of such property, Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 33.  This matter is subject to Council Review and action pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter and Article 16 of the General Municipal Law.

Items.MatterName: ULURP, 640 Broadway, Brooklyn (C090379HAK)

Items.Title: Application no. N 090364 ZRY, submitted by the Department of City Planning pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, establishing two new zoning districts: C6-3D and R9D and modifying related regulations.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, establishing two new zoning districts: C6-3D and R9D and modifying related regulations (N090364ZRY)

Items.Title: Application no. N 090365 ZMX, submitted by the Department of City Planning pursuant to Sections 197-c and  201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Map of the City of New York, Section Nos. 3b and 6a.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning Map amendment, Section Nos. 3b and 6a (N090365ZMX)

Items.Title: Application no. 20105018 HKM (N 100003 HKM), pursuant to §3020 of the Charter of the City of New York, concerning the designation (List No.414, LP-2327) by the Landmarks Preservation Commission of the John Pierce Residence, (Block 1287, Lot 10) as an historic landmark, Council District no. 3.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
